nodes.text: Krismo Sodi was the leader of the Kage Warriors on the planet Quarzite and the brother of Pluma Sodi. He led an assault on the subtram and managed to rescue his sister with the eventual help of Asajj Ventress before the train got to the tyrannical Quarzite leader, Otua Blank.

Krismo was the most skilled and deadliest member of the Kage Warriors,[source?] serving as their leader at the time of the Clone Wars. From atop a galloping Milodon, he led his warriors through the subterranean caverns of Quarzite against the Belugan forces of Lord Otua Blank.

Once he reached the subtram, he grappled with bounty hunters in Boba Fett's team, defeating Latts Razzi and C-21 Highsinger relatively quickly. After killing Rigosso, Krismo faced Fett himself who, in the ensuing fight, fell on top of the chest his job was to protect, accidentally releasing Pluma Sodi. Fett was surprised to see a woman tumble out of the chest and Krismo took advantage of the moment, knocking him out. A moment later, Krismo encountered Asajj Ventress. The two fought, ending with Krismo and Pluma handcuffed. The trio went to the rear of the tram, where Ventress and released Pluma for a price. As this was done, Krismo and Pluma left the tram back to their home via Milodon.
Krismo Sodi was protective over his family, especially over his sister, showing that he loves and cares for them.

Krismo was a very agile and skilled warrior among the Kage, being able to throw off two armed bounty hunters off the subtram while also managing to incapacitate Boba Fett, and even disarming former Dark Acolyte Asajj Ventress of her lightsabers before being overwhelmed. He was highly skilled in martial arts as well.

His designs were based off early drawings of Obi-Wan Kenobi as a Padawan. Also he and Pluma Sodi were originally going to be an engaged couple rather than brother and sister in the original script, according to StarWars.com behind the scenes.[source?]
Krismo appeared in the twentieth episode of The Clone Wars television series' fourth season, entitled Bounty. He was voiced by actor Ben Diskin, who had also voiced Otua Blank in the same episode.
